A secondary objective of the study would be to prepare a plan
which would stimulate formation of other regional networks and,
eventually, both national educational television and radio networks.
In furtherance of these objectives Region IV of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters, including representatives
of the states mentioned above, and with the participation of Mr.
William G. Harley, President of the National Association of Educa¬
tional Broadcasters and Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director,
unanimously passed the following resolution supporting this project;
RESOLUTION PASSED BY REGION IV, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL
BROADCASTERS AT REGIONAL CONVENTION, JANUARY 15, 19#,
MINNEAPOLIS, MINNESOTA
